Subjective: Trouble passing hard stools for several months. Stools hardly come out at all, sometimes not going to the toilet for 2-3 days. Abdominal pain, mainly abdominal cramps. Bloating, stomach is swollen. Underweight, struggling with weight for a while. Improvement with olive oil, but wondering if it's a permanent solution. Sensitive to palpation on the bottom left. No fever, no blood in stool, no change in urination, regular periods. Concern about bowel problems, want to know if it's something serious, want to know what can be done about it, want to make stool softer. Want to discuss dietitian next time. Impact on daily life: unable to play tennis due to fatigue.
Objective: Vitals: normal. Physical Exam: abdominal pain, mainly abdominal cramps; bloating, stomach is swollen; sensitive to palpation on the bottom left; normal bowel sounds; varying tympani; no pain on palpation on the back, front, and bottom right.
Assessment: Irritable bowel syndrome, susp. cause. No signs of ulcerative colitis.
Plan: Prescribe psyllium fibre sachets to soften stool
Take fibre sachets every day for 6 weeks
Follow-up if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or blood in stool appears
